memberdef.definition: PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, std::optional< int > max_iter=std::nullopt, std::optional< double > res_tol=std::nullopt, std::optional< bool > batch_solver_logger=std::nullopt, std::optional< int > preconditioner_max_block_size=std::nullopt)
memberdef.name: PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver

briefdescription.para: Instantiate a polar Poisson-like solver using FEM with B-splines.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
The maximum number of iterations possible for the batched CSR solver.
The residual tolerance for the batched CSR solver. Be careful! the relative residual provided here, will be used as "implicit residual" in ginkgo solver.
Indicates whether log information such as the residual and the number of iterations should be monitored.
The maximum size of the Jacobi preconditioner used by the batched CSR solver.
A class describing a mapping from curvilinear coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_singular_elements
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Kokkos::View< double **, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const values_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const col_idx_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const nnz_per_row_csr_host)
memberdef.name: compute_singular_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to the singular area. ie: the region enclosing the O-point.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix).
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_overlapping_singular_elements
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Kokkos::View< double **, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const values_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const col_idx_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const nnz_per_row_csr_host)
memberdef.name: compute_overlapping_singular_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to singular elements overlapping with regular grid.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix)
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::compute_stencil_elements
memberdef.argsstring: (ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, Mapping const &mapping, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Kokkos::View< double **, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const values_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const col_idx_csr_host, Kokkos::View< int *, Kokkos::LayoutRight, Kokkos::HostSpace > const nnz_per_row_csr_host)
memberdef.name: compute_stencil_elements

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to the regular stencil ie: out to singular or overlapping areas.

parameterdescription.para: The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
A 2D Kokkos view which stores the values of non-zero elements for the whole batch.
A 1D Kokkos view which stores the column indices for each non-zero component.(only for one matrix)
A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the count of the non-zeros along the lines of the matrix.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::operator()
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Solve the Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: This operator returns the coefficients associated with the B-Splines of the solution $\phi$.

parameterdescription.para: The rhs $ \rho$ of the Poisson-like equation. The type is templated but we can use the PoissonLikeRHSFunction class. It must be an object with an operator() which evaluates a CoordRTheta and can be called from CPU.
The spline representation of the solution $\phi$, also used as initial data for the iterative solver.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::operator()
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Solve the Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: This operator uses the other operator () and returns the values on the grid of the solution $\phi$.

parameterdescription.para: The rhs $ \rho$ of the Poisson-like equation. The type is templated but we can use the PoissonLikeRHSFunction class. It must be an object with an operator() which evaluates a CoordRTheta and can be called from CPU.
The values of the solution $\phi$ on the given coords_eval, also used as initial data for the iterative solver.

memberdef.definition: double PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_matrix_stencil_element
memberdef.argsstring: (IdxBSRTheta idx_test, IdxBSRTheta idx_trial, ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &evaluator, Mapping const &mapping)
memberdef.name: get_matrix_stencil_element

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix element corresponding to two tensor product splines with index idx_test and idx_trial.

parameterdescription.para: The index for polar B-spline in the test space.
The index for polar B-spline in the trial space.
The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $ (r, \theta) $.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.

simplesect.para: The value of the matrix element.

memberdef.definition: void PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::init_nnz_per_line
memberdef.name: init_nnz_per_line

briefdescription.para: Fills the nnz data structure by computing the number of non-zero per line. This number is linked to the weak formulation and depends on $(r,\theta)$ splines. After this function the array will contain: nnz_per_row[0] = 0. nnz_per_row[1] = 0. nnz_per_row[2] = number of non-zero elements in line 0. nnz_per_row[3] = number of non-zero elements in lines 0-1. ..._per_row nnz_per_row[matrix_size] = number of non-zero elements in lines 0-(matrix_size-1).

parameterdescription.para: A 1D Kokkos view of length matrix_size+1 which stores the sum of the non-zeros in the matrix on all lines up to the one in.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_FUNCTION IdxRangeQuadratureRTheta PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_quadrature_between_knots
memberdef.argsstring: (Idx< KnotsR > start_knot_r, Idx< KnotsR > end_knot_r, Idx< KnotsTheta > start_knot_theta, Idx< KnotsTheta > end_knot_theta) const
memberdef.name: get_quadrature_between_knots

briefdescription.para: Compute the quadrature range between a provided set of knots.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the range of quadrature points which are found between a set of knots in both the radial and poloidal directions. In order to return a contiguous range the result may include indices which are outside the domain. A modulo operator should be applied before using the indices.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the knot describing the lower bound of the domain of interest in the radial direction.
The index of the knot describing the upper bound of the domain of interest in the radial direction.
The index of the knot describing the lower bound of the domain of interest in the poloidal direction.
The index of the knot describing the upper bound of the domain of interest in the poloidal direction.

simplesect.para: The range of quadrature points in the specified domain.

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_FUNCTION double PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::weak_integral_element
memberdef.argsstring: (IdxBSPolar idx_test, IdxBSPolar idx_trial, IdxQuadratureRTheta idx_quad, ConstSpline2D coeff_alpha, ConstSpline2D coeff_beta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound const &spline_evaluator, Mapping const &mapping, DField< IdxRangeQuadratureRTheta > int_volume)
memberdef.name: weak_integral_element

briefdescription.para: Computes a quadrature summand corresponding to the inner product.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the test basis spline.
The index of the trial basis spline.
The index for the point in the quadrature scheme.
The spline representation of the $ \alpha $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
The spline representation of the $ \beta $ function in the definition of the Poisson-like equation.
An evaluator for evaluating 2D splines on $(r,\theta)$.
The mapping from the logical domain to the physical domain where the equation is defined.
The integral volume associated with each point used in the quadrature scheme.

simplesect.para: inner product of the test and trial spline is computed using a quadrature. This function returns one summand of the quadrature for the quadrature point given by the indices.

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_FUNCTION auto PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_polar_bspline_vals_and_derivs
memberdef.name: get_polar_bspline_vals_and_derivs

briefdescription.para: Get the value and derivative of the specified polar bspline at the specified quadrature point.

detaileddescription.para: This method calculates the value and the derivatives of polar bsplines. It is templated by calculate_derivs to avoid code duplication between get_polar_bspline_vals_and_derivs and get_polar_bspline_vals. The calling method should not need to use the template parameter.

parameterdescription.para: The value of the specified polar bspline at the specified point.
The coordinate where the value of the polar bspline should be calculated.
The polar bspline of interest.

simplesect.para: The derivative of the polar bspline (only returned if calculate_derivs is true).

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION double PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::get_polar_bspline_vals
memberdef.name: get_polar_bspline_vals

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the specified polar bspline at the specified point.

parameterdescription.para: The coordinate where the value of the polar bspline should be calculated.
The polar bspline of interest.

simplesect.para: The value of the polar bspline at the coordinate.

memberdef.definition: static KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION IdxBSPolar PolarSplineFEMPoissonLikeSolver< GridR, GridTheta, PolarBSplinesRTheta, SplineRThetaEvaluatorNullBound, IdxRangeFull >::to_polar
memberdef.name: to_polar

detaileddescription.para: Convert a 2D (r,theta) bspline index into a polar bspline index.

parameterdescription.para: The 2D (r,theta) bspline index.

briefdescription.para: Define a polar PDE solver for a Poisson-like equation.

detaileddescription.para: Solve the following Partial Differential Equation

As finite element basis functions we will use polar b-splines which are divided into two types: 1) Basis splines that can be written as a tensor product of 1d basis splines ("non-singular B-splines") 2) Basis splines that cover the centre point and are defined as a linear combination of basis splines of type 1 ("singular B-splines")
(see in Emily Bourne's thesis "Non-Uniform Numerical Schemes for the Modelling of Turbulence in the 5D GYSELA Code". December 2022.)

parameterdescription.para: The radial grid type.
The poloidal grid type.
The type of the 2D polar B-splines (on the coordinate system $(r,\theta)$ including B-splines which traverse the O point).
The type of the 2D (cross-product) spline evaluator.
The full index range of $ \phi $ including any batch dimensions.
